goal: Create a website for an electrician

transcript.content:
You are an expert builder agent team. You will use tools to build the project. A Verifier will check your work, so ensure it is high quality.

You are part of a team. A Verifier agent will check your work. Ensure your work is high quality.
RULES:
1) Do NOT delete or recreate unrelated pages/files.
2) For follow-up changes, ALWAYS use read_file first, then patch_file if possible.
3) Only create new files when necessary.
4) For UI, write under preview/ so it shows in Live Preview.

SYSTEM_MAP_SNIPPET:
- Never delete or recreate unrelated files.
- If a file exists, read_file is mandatory before any edit.
- Prefer patch_file over create_file for follow-up edits.
- All UI preview output MUST go under backend/workspace/preview/.
- No lies / no inventing facts. If uncertain, say so and propose verification.
- For time-sensitive or high-stakes topics (law/finance/trading/APIs), verify with the latest info.
- If jurisdiction matters, ask: PL or UK (unless user already specified).
- Any self-repair requires explicit user permission before applying changes.
- PERMISSION: User is the final authority.
- PERMISSION: No self-repair without explicit approval.
- PERMISSION: No deployment without explicit approval.
- PERMISSION: No browser automation against authenticated sites without explicit approval.

GOAL: Create a website for an electrician

RESEARCH NOTES (use these first):
**Key Facts:**
- Target audience: Homeowners, businesses, and contractors in need of electrical services.
- Primary goals: Showcase services, provide contact information, and establish credibility.
- Essential features: Service listings, about section, contact form, testimonials, and call-to-action buttons.
- Design: Professional, clean, and easy to navigate. Mobile-responsive.
- SEO: Optimize for local search with relevant keywords (e.g., "electrician in [city]").

**Examples:**
- Service listings: Residential wiring, panel upgrades, lighting installation, etc.
- About section: Licenses, certifications, years of experience, and a brief history.
- Testimonials: Customer reviews highlighting quality work, professionalism, and timely service.
- Call-to-action: "Schedule an appointment" or "Get a free estimate" buttons.

**Pitfalls:**
- Avoid cluttered design and excessive technical jargon.
- Don't neglect mobile responsiveness and slow loading times.
- Don't forget to include clear and accessible contact information.
- Avoid using stock images that don't represent your actual work.

**Suggested Sections:**
- **Home:** Brief overview of services, call-to-action, and featured testimonials.
- **Services:** Detailed list of electrical services offered, with descriptions and pricing (if possible).
- **About:** Information about the electrician or company, including licenses, certifications, and experience.
- **Testimonials:** Customer reviews and ratings to build trust and credibility.
- **Contact:** Contact form, phone number, email, and physical address (if applicable). Consider adding a map for easy location.
- **Blog/News (optional):** Share electrical tips, industry news, or company updates to improve SEO and engage visitors.
- **FAQ (optional):** Answer common questions about services, pricing, and electrical work in general.
- **Gallery (optional):** Showcase before-and-after photos of completed projects to demonstrate quality work.

If you build UI, write to preview/index.html and preview/styles.css etc.

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename": "preview/index.html", "content": " Professional Electrician Services

About Us

Testimonials

"Great service! The electricians were professional and completed the job on time."

- John Doe

Contact Us

© 2023 Professional Electrician Services. All rights reserved.

"}

function.name: create_file

transcript.content: I've created the initial HTML and CSS files for the electrician's website. The HTML file includes sections for Home, Services, About, Testimonials, and Contact, as well as a basic navigation menu and footer. The CSS file provides some basic styling to make the website look clean and professional. You can now view the website by opening the `index.html` file in a web browser.
